availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew A. Silver (Mercer County, KY, auctioneer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, auctioneer. Virginia native. Married to Sarah E. Board in Anderson County, Kentucky, on March 4, 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1850. Auctioneer in Mercer County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 901.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 705.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 47B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Anderson County Marriages, Film 000259310, p. 13.
"Andrew A Silver (1827-1877)," Find A Grave, Memorial 79040858, accessed November 11, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/79040858.
